Passage: A researcher fed honeybee larvae separately with fresh royal jelly and royal jelly that had been stored for 30 days. The results showed that the larvae fed with fresh royal jelly grew into queens. Further research found that a protein called "royalactin" in fresh royal jelly can promote the secretion of growth hormone, making the larvae have the characteristics of queen bee, such as larger body size and well-developed ovaries. The researchers fed fruit flies with this protein, and the fruit flies also showed an increase in body length, number of eggs and lifespan, indicating that the effect of this protein on biological characteristics is cross-species.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can support the above researchers' findings?
A. A.The worker bees and queen bees in the colony are all female and genetically identical, and their larvae are no different.
B. B.There is little genetic difference between bees and fruit flies, and they share many of the same biological characteristics.
C. C."Royalactin" can only be stored for a short time, and it will be broken down into other substances over a long period of time.
D. D.The food for bee larvae that can grow into queens is royal jelly, while the food for other larvae is only pollen and honey.
Answer:

Passage: British scientists wrote in the November 11, 2010 issue of the journal Nature and pointed out that they had found fossilized bacteria in Scottish rocks that might have lived about 1.2 billion years ago. This suggests that the concentration of oxygen on Earth has increased to the level needed for human evolution. This major event took place 1.2 billion years ago and it was 400 million years earlier than scientists previously thought. The new research is expected to give scientists a new understanding of the timetable for the evolution of the Earth's atmosphere and the life that depends on it for a living.Question: Which of the followings is assumed by the above findings of scientists?

B. B.The bacteria began to use oxygen in chemical reactions about 1.2 billion years ago to gain energy to survive.
C. C.The increase in the concentration of oxygen indicates that the organisms that dominate the earth have changed from simple organic matter to complex multicellular organic matter.
D. D.Only the concentration of oxygen in the atmosphere increases to a critical point can some bacteria survive.

Passage: There are thousands of genes in nature. Which genes are the most common and abundant? After successfully decoding a large number of genomes, a research institute found the answer: transposons, known as "selfish DNA". The abundance and breadth of transposon genes indicate that they play a vital role in evolution and the maintenance of biodiversity.Biology textbooks generally believe that the enzyme that can fix carbon dioxide in photosynthesis is the most abundant enzyme on earth, and some scholars have speculated that the genes that can encode this enzyme should also be the most abundant. But the study found that transposons, known as "junk DNA", instead dominate the known genetic world.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the speculation of the scholar(there is a version of the findings of the study)?
A. A.The basic function of transposons is to spread themselves everywhere.
B. B.The same enzyme is sometimes encoded by different genes.
C. C.Different enzymes may have the same gene to encode.
D. D.Different enzymes require different genes to encode.

This suggests that eating too much sugar may form a vicious circle, that is, eating sugar regularly will lead to a decrease in the sensitivity of taste buds to sweetness, and a decrease in satisfaction caused by eating the same amount of sugar, which will subconsciously ask for more sugar. Passage: The Chinese surname has a very big characteristic, that is, it is the same Han surname, but it is likely to have a very big difference in consanguinity. Generally speaking, taking Wuyishan-Nanling as the boundary, the consanguinity of Chinese surnames is obviously divided into two branches: the north and the south.The consanguinity of the Han nationality between the two places is quite different, even greater than that between the Han nationality in the north and south and the local ethnic minorities. This shows that with the expansion of the population, the Han nationality continued to go south and crossed the Yangtze River into Huguang more than 2000 years ago, and finally crossed the strait to Hainan Island. During this process, the Han people who moved south continued to integrate with many ethnic minorities who spoke Dong-Tai, South Asian and Miao languages, thus diluting the consanguinity of the Han nationality in the north.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best refute the above argument?
A. A.The ethnic minorities in the south may have been the northerners who migrated to the south a long time ago.
B. B.Feudal emperors once sealed some of the ethnic minorities with the surnames of emperors.
C. C.The north and south branches with the same surname may not come from the same ancestor.
D. D.In history, there have also been cases in which ethnic minorities moved northward.
Answer:

Passage: In 2010, the specific situation of schools in a country providing training for teachers is as follows: 38% of public schools have 1%-25% of teachers attend, 18% of public schools have 26%-50% of teachers attend, 13% of public schools have 51%-75% of teachers attend, and 30% of public schools have 76% or more teachers attend in such training. In contrast, 37% of rural schools have 1% -25% of teachers attend, 20% of rural schools have 26%- 50% of teachers attend, 12% of rural schools have 51%-75% of teachers attend, and 29% of rural schools have 76% or more teachers attend. This shows that teachers in rural schools in the country are equally likely to receive training as school teachers in cities, suburbs and towns.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best refute the above argument?
A. A.The contents of teacher training are rich and varied.
B. B.The conditions of teacher training are very different, and the effects are also different.
C. C.Some teachers work in public schools as well as part-time jobs in rural schools.
D. D.There are also many public schools in the countryside and many rural schools in the suburbs.
Answer:

Prompt: High-level strategy for competitive programming contests
Output: Less than 100 words

A competitive programming contest is a game where contestants solve algorithmic programming problems. Contestants are ranked based on the number of problems they solve within the given time frame, and the competitors with the highest scores win prizes.

To develop a high-level strategy for competitive programming contests, it is important to understand the main aspects that contribute to success. Firstly, you need to have a solid understanding of algorithms and data structures, as well as proficiency in one or more programming languages. This is critical in solving problems efficiently and accurately.

Another important aspect is time management. Since the contest involves solving multiple problems within a limited time frame, it is crucial to prioritize problems based on their difficulty and focus only on the most manageable ones. This requires a balance between solving problems quickly and accurately.

Finally, you need to have a clear mindset and remain calm during the competition. This involves managing stress, staying focused, and avoiding careless mistakes. By developing a high-level strategy that includes these main aspects, you can increase your chances of success in competitive programming contests.

A. A.Zhao chose to travel by car.
B. B.Zhao does not choose to travel by car.
C. C.Li chose to travel by ship.
D. D.Zhang chose to travel by plane.

If the first option is right, you generate the answer 'A', if the second option is right, you generate the answer 'B', if the third option is right, you generate the answer 'C', if the fourth option is right, you generate the answer 'D'. Passage: Using the X-ray technology of the European Synchrotron radiation Accelerator, the researchers scanned a fossil of a true-footed snake hidden in an ancient rock dating back 9500 million years. It turns out that this snake is very similar to modern terrestrial lizards, which helps to unravel the mystery of the origin of snakes. The research report points out that the snake is 50 centimeters long. On the surface, it has only one foot, about 2 centimeters long. The other foot of the real foot snake was found by X-ray scanning. The reason why this foot is not easy to detect is that it was alienated in the rock, with only four bones in its ankle and no toes, indicating that the feet of true-footed snakes had deteriorated at that time.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the views of the above scholars?
A. A.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from non-footed animal to legged lizards.
B. B.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from a legged animal to non-footed animal.
C. C.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes degenerated from non-footed animal to a legged lizard.
D. D.The age of this true-footed snake coincides with the period when snakes degenerated from a legged animal to a non-footed animal.
Answer:
